page.title: 03FARMING
page.content: Pool House Farm is situated at the end of a track, about three-quarters of a mile from the main road.The parish is called Purshull Green.The pool, which obviously gives the farm it's name, measures three acres, and is covered in ducks, moorhens and sometimes swans.Most of the land belonging to the farm is pasture/sileage land.There is a wood nearby, consisting of conifers.The main industry of the farm is dairying.There is a herd of two hundred Fresian cows and a few sheep.The farm belongs to Mr and Mrs Truswell.The farm employs five agricultural workers as well as members of the family.Their son, his wife and his two daughters live there. The children go to a Middle School in Droitwich, called St.Richard de Wych.Droitwich is about five miles
